When elevator when it up its like going down slowly and when i press b to go to the position it like moving down like a tiny bit idk whats the problem if its like PID or something else pls help heres my github

github.com

All of your gains look very wrong. For example, why do you have a -18 V kG? It should be a small positive number. Why is kV only 0.2 V/rps? At a gear ratio of 9.0, it should be around 1.1 V/rps.

I would recommend reading through the WPILib Tuning a Vertical Elevator documentation.

Please don’t suggest that teams use advanced tooling when they’re struggling with the basics…

Yes they are struggling but I don’t think it is advanced tool. This year we used it easily for the first time and it helped and saved a lot tuned in 5 minutes(I had never tuned PID before). Just make sure to give limits for any case.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-26T21:04:18.785Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":35.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":493226,"topic_slug":"pls-help-with-kraken-motion-magic-elevator","display_username":"Emre ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/pls-help-with-kraken-motion-magic-elevator/493226/8","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3541853,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-26T21:06:33.700Z","cooked":"

It works well unless it doesn’t, and if you don’t know what you’re doing you have no way to know which it is until you try to use the gains.

I’m glad it worked for you but it is not a replacement for knowing how to tune.
